newsitem.title: USA: Chart House says Kuntz to resign in June.
newsitem.headline: Chart House says Kuntz to resign in June.

text.p: Chart House Enterprises Inc said Friday Chief Financial Officer William Kuntz Jr., who has been acting as interim president and chief executive officer, plans to resign in June.
The company said he will be replaced as CFO by James Wendler, who is currently vice president and chief accounting officer.
The company said Stephen McGillin, executive vice president of operations, will become acting president.

In a statement, Kuntz said that this is the "right time" for him to leave the company, and that he knew his role would be "an interim one" when he assumed responsibilities of president and chief executive in November.
In November, the company announced Kuntz was assuming some of the responsibilities of the resigning president and chief executive for an interim period.
The company also said its shareholders have approved the issuing of 3.4 million shares of common stock at $5.75 per share to Chart House Investors LLC, an affiliate of Equity Group Investments Inc.
Equity is a privately held investment company headed by Sam Zell.
The proceeds from the sale of shares will be applied to repay existing indebtedness.
Chart House operates 64 restaurants in the United States, the U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico.
